# National Road 3 (Democratic Republic of the Congo)

National Road 3 (N3) is a road in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It runs from the city of Bukavu on the south end of Lake Kivu to the city of Kisangani.
The road begins northwest of Bukavu at Miti, travels  northwest to Hombo at the border of North Kivu. In North Kivu it travels  to Walikale and a further  to Oso at the border of Maniema. It then runs  to Lubutu,  to Pene Tungu and finally  to Kisangani. Kisangani is a river port, the farthest navigable point on the Congo River from the capital Kinshasa. Riverboats and small ships link Kisangani to Kinshasa.
The road had deteriorated over the course of the First and Second Congo Wars and became impassable on the unpaved sections. The section north of Walikale was rebuilt by the German NGO Welthungerhilfe (), which began work in 2000, and was about a quarter complete by June 2006, and about 550 km were completed by 2010.
